Key Match Events: Craig Goodwin scored a screamer to give the Socceroos the lead.
Xie Wenneng scored against the run of play in the first half, giving China the lead.
Lewis Miller scored a header in first-half stoppage time to level the score.
Nishan Velupillay scored a debut goal in stoppage time to secure the victory for the Socceroos.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Goodwin commented that his goal was 'exactly how I imagined it' and praised the team's character in responding to previous poor results.
Goalkeeper Joe Gauci noted the team's patience and trust in their opportunities, which was different from their previous games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Tony Popovic's first as coach of the Socceroos.
The attendance at Adelaide Oval was 46,291.
China has now lost four-straight internationals for the first time since 2003.
